titles: The black book opened, or traytors arraigned and condemned by their own confession, being a tragical discourse between a noble cavalier and a select number of those pure refined, diabolical saints, called (by the most loyal subjects) King-killers. As it is to be acted at the Red-Bull in St. Johns street by a company of blind Bloomsbury fidlers, the ablest now extant.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Charles --  I, --  King of England, 1600-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
